alert.note: Alert for Latah; Shoshone (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 03 at 11:08AM MST until March 04 at 1:04PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: .Rain and melting snow today will contribute to rises on creeks and streams in north Idaho. Rock slides, minor field flooding, and mudslides in steep terrain may also be possible. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of North Idaho, including the following counties, Benewah, Kootenai, Latah and Shoshone. * WHEN...Until noon PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. Rock slides and mudslides in steep terrain are also possible. Minor field flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 957 AM PST, Rain and snowmelt is occurring, with minor flooding possible. - Additional rainfall amounts less than 0.4 inches over lower elevations with less than 0.75 inches over mountains are expected over the area. This additional rain could result in minor flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
